library(readxl)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(knitr)

# Load the dataset
file_path <- "C:/Users/Shrey Shah/Desktop/Typical_Employee_Survey_Data (1).xlsx"
Typical_Employee_Survey_Data_1_ <- read_excel(file_path)
head(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data_1_)

#Add Header Row

colnames <- c("Column1", "Column2", "Column3", "column4", "column5", "column6", "column7", "column8", "column9", "column10", "column11" )
head(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data_1_, 10)

#Print the 5-point summary and generate boxplots for numerical columns

summary(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data_1_)

numerical_columns <- sapply(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data_1_, is.numeric)
for (col in names(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data_1_)[numerical_columns]) {
  boxplot(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data_1_[[col]], main = paste("Boxplot of", col), ylab = col)
}

numerical_columns <- sapply(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data_1_, is.numeric)
for (col in names(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data_1_)[numerical_columns]) {
  boxplot(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data_1_[[col]], main = paste("Boxplot of", col), ylab = col)
}

# Convert necessary columns to factors



factor_columns <- c("Column1", "Column2")  
Typical_Employee_Survey_Data_1_[factor_columns] <- lapply(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data_1_[factor_columns], as.factor)
str(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data_1_)

# Plot the right visual for each column


for (col in names(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data_1_)) {
  if (is.numeric(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data_1_[["col1"]])) {
    ggplot(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data_1_, aes_string(col)) + geom_histogram(binwidth = 10, fill = "blue") + ggtitle(paste("Histogram of", col))
  } else if (is.factor(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data_1_[["col1"]])) {
    ggplot(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data_1_, aes_string(col)) + geom_bar(fill = "green") + ggtitle(paste("Bar plot of", col))
